item.title: BBL Batting Analytics
item.description: As BBL|08 is upon us, I decided to take a look over the past seven seasons and understand the Big Bash from a statistical standpoint. To be able to have such a large dataset has been a lot of fun and Iâ€™d love suggestions for further comparisons to be made. This first article will focus on batsmen, with future articles to follow on bowlers and teams. This is also my first attempt at writing a blog post within RMarkdown, so be with me.

item.title: ScatterBat
item.description: ## ## Attaching package: 'dplyr' ## The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': ## ## filter, lag ## The following objects are masked from 'package:base': ## ## intersect, setdiff, setequal, union Introducting ScatterBat! ScatterBats <- bats %>% distinct(R,B, .keep_all = TRUE) %>% select(Season, Season.Match.No, Batter, R, B) colnames(ScatterBats)[colnames(ScatterBats) == 'Season.Match.No'] <- 'Match' ggplot(ScatterBats, aes(R,B)) + geom_bin2d(binwidth = c(0.99999,0.99999)) + theme_ipsum_rc() + theme(legend.position="none") + labs(x ="Runs",y ="Balls", title = "BBL ScatterBat - Every BBL Innings Visualised") datatable(ScatterBats) {"
